formElement.label: Configuration Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin.
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration.
A Configuration defines connection details and can be created by going to plugin configuration page.

formElement.label: Connection factory name:
formElement.documentation: What would you like to name your new connection factory?

formElement.label: JNDI name:
formElement.documentation: What JNDI Name would you like to use to look up your new connection factory?

formElement.label: Subscription sharing policy:
formElement.documentation: The Connection Factory Subscription Sharing Policy Subscribers can be used to control which subscribers can access new subscriptions. Should subscriptions created using this factory be sharable?

formElement.label: Client id policy:
formElement.documentation: The Client ID Policy indicates whether more than one JMS connection can use the same Client ID. Oracle recommends setting the Client ID policy to Unrestricted if sharing durable subscribers. Subscriptions created with different Client ID policies are always treated as independent subscriptions. What Client ID Policy would you like to use?

formElement.label: Maximum messages per session:
formElement.documentation: A connection factory can limit the number of messages that can queued for an asynchronous session. Should this connection factory impose a limit?

formElement.label: XA connection factory enabled:
formElement.documentation: Should this connection factory create sessions that are JTA aware, and create XA queues and XA topics?

formElement.label: Attach JMSX userid:
formElement.documentation: Should the authenticated user name be attached to sent messages if the JMS destination is configured to support this behavior?

formElement.label: Server Name:
formElement.documentation: Server name is required if you're not sure that JMS Module exists. If it does not - procedure will create JMS module and add Server as target to it.
